column5: How large is the snow pack North of Nakina? Lots of snow means full river flow and full lakes and visa versa.

Hard to pinpoint Nakina on this map [from this site], but it looks like the snow depth in the area surrounding Nakina is +/- 10cm (~4") from the average.Overall, it looks like North America is about average for snow pack levels.

Our snow and ice is well short of normal. I would say a foot less of each, if not more for the ice. I was out 2 weeks ago and we had 18-20 inches, usually would have close to 3 feet. Also looking to be quite mild the remainder of the winter, http://www.accuweather.com/en/ca/nak...monyr=3/1/2016 I expect to be fishing out of a boat on the rivers before winter walleye season closes on Apr. 15th.
